title: Hazardous Weather Outlook for McHenry Co., IL
content: <pre>FLUS43 KLOT 022034 HWOLOT Hazardous Weather Outlook National Weather Service Chicago/Romeoville IL 334 PM CDT Sat Jun 2 2018 Winnebago-Boone-McHenry-Lake Illinois-Ogle-Lee-De Kalb-Kane- DuPage-Cook-La Salle-Kendall-Grundy-Will-Kankakee-Livingston- Iroquois-Ford-Lake Indiana-Porter-Newton-Jasper-Benton- 334 PM CDT Sat Jun 2 2018 /434 PM EDT Sat Jun 2 2018/ THIS HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK IS FOR North Central Illinois… Northeast Illinois AND Northwest Indiana. .DAY ONE…Tonight. WEATHER HAZARDS EXPECTED: Significant Thunderstorm Risk...with an associated: Limited Hail Risk...up to quarter size. Limited Thunderstorm Wind Damage Risk...up to 60 mph. Limited Flooding Risk. DISCUSSION: A cold front moving across the region tonight will result in showers and some thunderstorms. A few of these storms may be strong to severe, with frequent lightning, gusty winds and large hail. Locally heavy rainfall with some of the strongest storms may result in localized flooding. .DAYS TWO THROUGH SEVEN…Sunday through Friday. Tuesday through Thursday… Limited Thunderstorm Risk. .SPOTTER INFORMATION STATEMENT… Spotters may be needed this evening. GENERAL STORM MOTION OF THE DAY: Moving east at 25 to 30 MPH. && </pre> https://wxn.io/ZrvqZ ------------------------------------------------ © Copyleft 2018 WxNotify. All wrongs reserved. You may unsubscribe from WxNotify e-mails by going to https://wxnotify.com/signin.html and removing the corresponding alert.
contentWithMarkup:
<pre>FLUS43 KLOT 022034 HWOLOT

Hazardous Weather Outlook National Weather Service Chicago/Romeoville IL 334 PM CDT Sat Jun 2 2018

Winnebago-Boone-McHenry-Lake Illinois-Ogle-Lee-De Kalb-Kane- DuPage-Cook-La Salle-Kendall-Grundy-Will-Kankakee-Livingston- Iroquois-Ford-Lake Indiana-Porter-Newton-Jasper-Benton- 334 PM CDT Sat Jun 2 2018 /434 PM EDT Sat Jun 2 2018/

THIS HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK IS FOR North Central Illinois… Northeast Illinois AND Northwest Indiana.

.DAY ONE…Tonight.

WEATHER HAZARDS EXPECTED:

Significant Thunderstorm Risk...with an associated:      Limited Hail Risk...up to quarter size.      Limited Thunderstorm Wind Damage Risk...up to 60 mph.  Limited Flooding Risk.

DISCUSSION:

A cold front moving across the region tonight will result in showers and some thunderstorms. A few of these storms may be strong to severe, with frequent lightning, gusty winds and large hail. Locally heavy rainfall with some of the strongest storms may result in localized flooding.

.DAYS TWO THROUGH SEVEN…Sunday through Friday.

Tuesday through Thursday…

Limited Thunderstorm Risk.

.SPOTTER INFORMATION STATEMENT…

Spotters may be needed this evening.

GENERAL STORM MOTION OF THE DAY:

Moving east at 25 to 30 MPH.

&& </pre>
